version_description:
-DS file has a new theme and improved usability
-Thumbnails are now displayed to make it easy to find your pictures
-It’s now possible to “verify the certificate” installed on the DiskStation to for an even more secure connection
-The original filename is now kept when uploading images from the iDevice’s albums
-Fixed an issue where the login page would flash on certain iDevices

The following features require DSM 4.3 (or DSM 5.0 when connecting with your QuickConnect ID)
-Files and folders can now be shared without creating a DSM account
-Advanced search options are now available in addition to searching by keyword filtering
-Folders can now be added to “Favourites” like in File Station
-It’s now possible to compress/extract files as in File Station
-Minor bug fixes

-The original filename is now kept when uploading images from the iDevice’s albums
-Fixed an issue where the login page would flash on certain iDevices

The following features require DSM 4.3 (or DSM 5.0 when connecting with your QuickConnect ID)
-Files and folders can now be shared without creating a DSM account
-Advanced search options are now available in addition to searching by keyword filtering
-Folders can now be added to “Favourites” like in File Station
-It’s now possible to compress/extract files as in File Station
-Minor bug fixes

-The original filename is now kept when uploading images from the iDevice’s albums
-Fixed an issue where the login page would flash on certain iDevices

-DS file has a new theme and improved usability
-Thumbnails are now displayed to make it easy to find your pictures
-It’s now possible to “verify the certificate” installed on the DiskStation to for an even more secure connection
-The original filename is now kept when uploading images from the iDevice’s albums
-Fixed an issue where the login page would flash on certain iDevices

The following features require DSM 4.3 (or DSM 5.0 when connecting with your QuickConnect ID)
-Files and folders can now be shared without creating a DSM account
-Advanced search options are now available in addition to searching by keyword filtering
-Folders can now be added to “Favourites” like in File Station
-It’s now possible to compress/extract files as in File Station
-Minor bug fixes

Video playback can now switch to HTTP when using a HTTPS connection
It's now possible to select multiple folders when customizing the advanced search
Actions can be applied on individual items in thumbnail mode
DS file has an updated form for contacting our Support team
Fixed an issue where documents wouldn’t open when using HTTPS
Fixed a login issue with accented credentials on certain DSM versions
Minor bug fixes

． The login history is shared between Synology Mobile Apps for more convenience (hostnames and account names)
． Opening a document with DS file from another app now allows to choose the destination (local files or on the DiskStation itself)
． Unicode domain names (also known as IDN) are now supported
． Fixed an issue where DSM 3.0 users wouldn't see tasks listed
． Minor bug fixes

． Unicode domain names (also known as IDN) are now supported
． Fixed an issue where DSM 3.0 users wouldn't see tasks listed
． Minor bug fixes

． Files can now be directly imported into your DiskStation from other cloud providers with the Document Provider (iOS 8 required)
． .SSA and .ASS subtitles are now supported
． It's now possible to eject USB drives connected to the DiskStation
． Download tasks can now be automatically resumed when you reopen the app from the background
． Minor bug fixes and usability enhancements

． Files can be pinned to mobile devices to be synced with the files on the DiskStation
． 2-step verification is supported for DSM 6.0 to provide extra security
． The built-in player supports subtitle sync and repeated playback
． You can now save a file from another app to DS file with the support for iOS 8 Action extension
． You can download images from the DiskStation to the photo album directly
． Fixed an issue where .txt files might be garbled after being opened
． Added Infuse as a third-party player
． Fixed an issue where downloading again might cause DS file to quit unexpectedly
． Minor bug fixes

．Supports backing up photos and videos automatically from your mobile device to the Synology NAS (iOS 9 or above required)
．Supports passcode lock and Touch ID to protect user privacy
．Supports sharing files on the Synology NAS to other mobile applications
．Supports auto-playing music and videos in the same folder
．Fixed an issue where sharing files from other mobile applications to DS file might fail
．Fixed an issue where files with uppercase extension might not be unzipped
．Minor bug fixes

- Fixed an issue where users might not be able to save PDF files from Safari to DS file
- Fixed an issue where DS photo might not be able to play videos through DS file
- Fixed an issue where the application might crash when playing 4K videos continuously
- Minor bug fixes

- The update is expected to be available in all regions within the next few days. The actual time of release may vary slightly depending on the region.
- This is the last version to support iOS 11. As for the next release, DS file will only support devices with iOS 12 or above versions.
- Added support for user interface in Thai language.
- Improved the menu layout for easier navigation of features.
- Improved the stability of connection when connecting via specific Internet service providers.
- Fixed the issue where signing in with a full QuickConnect address might cause login failure.
- Fixed the issue where viewing PDF files on iOS 13 might cause the app to freeze.
- Fixed the issue where the app will not play songs when it runs in the background or when the device is locked.
- Fixed the issue where photos already downloaded to the device from the app might be synced back to the app again.
- Fixed the issue where unexpected passcode requests might pop up in iOS 13 when the passcode is set for the app and the app is running in the background.

- Fixed the issue where photos already downloaded to the device from the app might be synced back to the app again.
- Fixed the issue where unexpected passcode requests might pop up in iOS 13 when the passcode is set for the app and the app is running in the background.

- Fixed the issue where files cannot be opened when connected to DSM 6.0.0 - 6.2.0 versions.
- Fixed the issue where offline files in DS file cannot be accessed via iOS Files.
- Fixed the issue where the app might quit unexpectedly when processing backup tasks which include damaged iOS Live Photos.

- Fixed the issue where content in .txt files might be garbled in DS file.
- Fixed the issue where saving videos from iOS Photos to DS file might fail.

- This update is only available for iOS 13 and above versions.
- This is the last version to support signing in through the WebDAV port. As for the next release, please sign in with the DSM port (5000 by default) instead.
- Enhanced security level of connections.
- Supports TLS 1.3 encrypted protocols and its modern compatibility for higher level of security when connected to Synology NAS running DSM 7.0.
- Enhanced the connection experience by reducing the probability of untrusted SSL certificates when connecting via QuickConnect.
- Shortened the photo thumbnail rendering time in File Station running on DSM 7.0 or above versions when backing up photos via DS file.
- Fixed an issue where uploading videos with the same name might fail.
- Fixed an issue where printing PDF files might fail.
- Fixed an issue where the application might quit unexpectedly when connecting via WebDAV.
- Fixed an issue where the "Always open HTML files using plain text format" setting in File Station is not applied on DS file.
- Fixed an issue where the application might quit unexpectedly when downloading multiple GIF files for offline access.
- Fixed an issue where the application might quit unexpectedly when uploading a large number of photos.
- Fixed an issue where the status bar at the top might not be hidden while playing videos.
- Fixed an issue where searching files by create date might fail when connected to Synology NAS running DSM 7.0.
- Fixed an issue where users are unable to download files or open PDF files when connected to Synology NAS running DSM 7.0.

- This update is only available for iOS 13 and above versions.
- This is the last version to support signing in through the WebDAV port. As for the next release, please sign in with the DSM port (5000 by default) instead.
- Enhanced security level of connections.
- Supports TLS 1.3 encrypted protocols and its modern compatibility for higher level of security when connected to Synology NAS running DSM 7.0.
- Enhanced the connection experience by reducing the probability of untrusted SSL certificates when connecting via QuickConnect.
- Shortened the photo thumbnail rendering time in File Station running on DSM 7.0 or above versions when backing up photos via DS file.
- Fixed an issue where uploading videos with the same name might fail.
- Fixed an issue where printing PDF files might fail.
- Fixed an issue where the application might quit unexpectedly when connecting via WebDAV.
- Fixed an issue where the "Always open HTML files using plain text format" setting in File Station is not applied on DS file.
- Fixed an issue where the application might quit unexpectedly when downloading multiple GIF files for offline access.
- Fixed an issue where the application might quit unexpectedly when uploading a large number of photos.
- Fixed an issue where the status bar at the top might not be hidden while playing videos.
- Fixed an issue where searching files by create date might fail when connected to Synology NAS running DSM 7.0.
- Fixed an issue where users are unable to download files or open PDF files when connected to Synology NAS running DSM 7.0.
